Description: A unique identifier assigned to each participant in the study.
The day number relative to the start of the study (e.g., Day 1, Day 2).
The calendar date on which the gaming session occurred (format: YYYY-MM-DD).
A sequential identifier for each gaming session on a given day for the participant.
The name of the game played during the session.
The time of day when the gaming session began (format: HH:MM:SS).
The length of the gaming session in minutes.
The genre(s) of the game played using IGDB categories.
Notes: Possible genres are: Adventure, Arcade, Card & Board Game, Fighting, Hack and slash/Beat 'em up, MOBA, Music, Platform, Puzzle, Racing, Real Time Strategy (RTS), Role-playing (RPG), Shooter, Simulator, Sport, Strategy, Tactical, Turn-based strategy (TBS), Visual Novel

Description: The platform on which the game was played, for use in future merging (here: always Xbox).
